title: An easy to find place to API documentation
body:
Forgive me but I'm trying hard to find the documentations for the REST API ...

I open a request for a feature that already implemented #12760 because I couldn't found it.

And even that response was not clear enough to me ( something like "the endpoint is like this bro.." but knowing the address is not enough. I need all paramenter, formats addresses etc...

Like this https://geth.ethereum.org/docs/interacting-with-geth/rpc/ns-admin. A very good example.

Or even this ( that I don't know what exactly is : that say "Beacon-API" but from Ethereum? ) https://ethereum.github.io/beacon-APIs/#/ 

So... ok... the address is ```/prysm/node/trusted_peers``` and now ? What I must pass? Is it POST? GET? Is the query parameter JSON? XML:? 

This page is even more confusing:

https://docs.prylabs.network/docs/how-prysm-works/prysm-public-api

The ```/p2p``` endpoint? where is it documented?
Is there more endpoints from ```/prysm/``` ? 
Why ```/p2p```is not under ```/prysm/``` like ```/node``` is ?
